title: 108_hr4915
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale or exchange of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, other property, or as compensation for services. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale or exchange of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion applies to stock in a qualified small business C corporation that is publicly traded on certain exchanges. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock in a qualified small business C corporation if the market capitalization is not more than $150,000,000. Market capitalization is determined by the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares. The reporting period for determining stock value under the Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004 is based on the most recent annual or quarterly report filed with the SEC. Aggregation rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) apply for valuation purposes. Rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) apply for valuation purposes. Additional rules under subsections (f), (g), (h), (i), (j), and (k) of section 1202 also apply, with a modification in subsection (j)(1)(A) substituting '1 year' for '5 years'. Qualified small business stock sales and exchanges under section 1202 are not considered under this section. Conforming amendments are made to sections 642(c)(4) and 643(a)(3) of the Code. The Code is amended to include sections 1203 in various sections, and a new subsection is added to section 1202. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. "Subchapter P of chapter 1 is amended to include a new item after section 1202." Sec. 1203 provides an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies. The amendments made by this section apply to securities acquired after the date of the enactment of this Act.
